page.title: 10THE DAILY LIFE OF A CHILD
page.content: My name is Katherine Duerden.I am 8 years old and I go to the village school. It is a new school.The old National school in the main street is being converted into a house.We start at 8.45 with assembly.After that we do maths and English in our work books until first playtime at 10.30.Then we either finish off work or read and do project work.This year we have studied grasses for an Aylesbury Vale science project and Ghana.At the end of term our concert was about Anansi a village drummer in Ghana. I played Anansi. Lunch is at 12.00.Meals are cooked at the school but I take a packed lunch. After lunch play we do some art and craft.Last play is at 14.15-14.30 then we have music or a story. School finishes at 3.00. I can walk home but half the pupils get the school bus to the neighbouuring villages.
